artifacts.summary: Supplementary research analyzing full proof reconstruction from closed tableau branches - what it would require (150-280 hours estimated), what it would provide (stronger completeness with proof terms), and why it is correctly excluded from Task 625 scope

partial_progress.details: Analyzed DerivationTree, ClosedBranch, tableau expansion, and proof extraction systems

findings_summary.main_question: What would full proof reconstruction from closed branches amount to?
key_findings: Current gap: ClosedBranch provides semantic closure evidence, but DerivationTree needs syntactic proof terms
Current extraction only works for direct axiom matches; contradiction/botPos closures produce no proof
Full reconstruction requires: enhanced closure tracking (history), rule correspondence proofs (14 rules), reconstruction algorithm, propositional infrastructure
Estimated effort: 150-280 hours (4-8 weeks focused work)
Alternative approaches available: selective reconstruction (~60-80 hours), axiom-based trust, external checker
findings_summary.recommendation: Proceed with Task 625 using existing infrastructure; document gaps; consider weaker theorem statement if needed; create separate task for full reconstruction when ready
